description: From Latin irratiōnālis, from ir- + ratiōnālis.

adjectives.description: irrational (comparative more irrational, superlative most irrational)

entries.meaning: (mathematics, arithmetic, number theory, not comparable) Of a real number, that cannot be written as the ratio of two integers.
A real number that can not be expressed as the quotient of two integers, an irrational number.
examples: The square root of 2, which was the first irrational to be discovered, was known to the early Pythagoreans, and ingenious methods of approximating to its value were discovered.
